title: Robbie Collins
content:
Hi friends

Please help me id these font used for Robbie Collins Plate

Thanks in advance

Hernando

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20091118211419im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Rob-Collins---Name-Plate_6398.jpg)
author: hernandomiguel

comments.content:
And if you would like the more complete, original which contains a serif, sans serif, and alternate version, look at Mason, which is available from Emigre or through MyFonts. As far as I am aware, Mason is the original and Morpheus is a blatant, near copy of Jonathan Barnbrook’s work. Mason came out in 1992.

[http://emigre.com/EF.php?fid=104](http://web.archive.org/web/20091118211419/http:/emigre.com/EF.php?fid=104)

_Mason came out in 1992._

It was actually released as “Ma **n** son” and renamed later.

That’s interesting. From what I am reading, the change came about because of sensitivity to the association with Charles Manson. I wonder if this is the real reason or an urban legend. Seems to be the only reason I can find. Thanks for the tip.
